register.description: Interrupter Management (xHCI)

bitfield.description: Interrupt enable
Interrupt pending. Set (to 1) when: IE = 1,USBOTGSS_IMOD[31:16] IMODC = 0, the associated event ring is not empty, USBOTGSS_ERDP_LO[3] EHB = 0.

register.description: Interrupter moderation (xHCI)

bitfield.description: Interrupt moderation counter: Loaded to IMODI whenever IP is cleared to 0, counts down to 0, and stops. IRQ is generated when counter is 0, event ring is not empty, USBOTGSS_IMAN[1] IE = 1, USBOTGSS_IMAN[0] IP = 1, USBOTGSS_ERDP_LO[3] EHB = 0. Can be directly written to at any time alter the interrupt rate
Interrupt moderation interval: Minimum inter-IRQ interval, in 250-ns increments.

bitenum.description: IRQ throttling disabled: IRQs generated immediately.

register.description: Global device Bus Configuration Register 0

bitfield.description: Endian mode for descriptor accesses.
Endian mode for data accesses.
INCR256 Burst Type Enable. 256×64/8= 2-kByte burst.
INCR128 Burst Type Enable. 128×64/8= 1-kByte burst.
INCR64 Burst Type Enable. 64×64/8= 512-Byte burst.
INCR32 Burst Type Enable. 32×64/8= 256-Byte burst.
INCR16 Burst Type Enable. 16×64/8= 128-Byte burst.
INCR8 Burst Type Enable. 8×64/8= 64-Byte burst.
INCR4 Burst Type Enable. 4×64/8= 32-Byte burst: RECOMMENDED Enables bursts of beat length 1, 2, 3, 4, and prevents (16-byte) descriptor accesses from being broken up: highly recommended.
Undefined Length INCR Burst Type Enable: DO NOT ENABLE When enabled, this has higher priority than other burst types.

register.description: Global device bus configuration register 1

bitfield.description: 1k-page boundary enable

bitenum.description: Master breaks requests only on 4-KiB boundaries.
Master breaks requests on all 1-KiB boundaries.

bitfield.description: Maximum number of outstanding (read or write) pipelined sequential (i.e. in-order) transaction requests on the master interface (field value+1)
Always write 0. (The result of writing a non-0 value is undetermined.)

register.description: Global TX threshold control register. Valid only in Host mode.

bitfield.description: Always write 0, result of writing of a non-zero value is undetermined.
USB Transmit Packet Count Enable: Enables/disables USB trasnmission multi-packet thresholding

bitenum.description: Disabled: Transmission is only started on the USB after the entire packet has been fetched into the corresponding TXFIFO. Rest of the register must be all-zero.

Enabled: USB transmission is started only after USB Transmit Packet Count amount of packets for the USB transaction (burst) are already in the corresponding TXFIFO This mode is only valid in the host, superspeed mode.

bitfield.description: USB Transmit Packet Count : Number of packets that must be in the TXFIFO before transmission for the corresponding USB transaction (burst) can start. Don't care if USBTXPKTCNTSEL=0.

bitenum.description: Use when and only when disabled (USBTXPKTCNTSEL=0)

bitfield.description: USB Maximum Transmit Burst Size. Max OUT burst size, when USBTXPKTCNTSEL=1. Avoids TX FIFO underrun when the system bus is slower than the USB. Only applies to SS Bulk / Iso / Int OUT endpoints in host mode. Don't care if USBTXPKTCNTSEL=0.

bitenum.description: Use when and only when disabled (USBTXPKTCNTSEL=0)
Burst of up to 1 (minimum value when enabled)

bitfield.description: Always write 0, result of writing of a non-zero value is undetermined.
Always write 0, result of writing of a non-zero value is undetermined.

register.description: Global RX Threshold Control Register

bitfield.description: USB ReceivePacket Count Enable Enables/disables USB reception multi-packet thresholding

bitenum.description: The core can only start reception on the USB when the RX FIFO has space for at least one packet. Rest of the register must be all-zero.
The core can only start reception on the USB when the RX FIFO has space for at least packet. This mode is only valid in the host mode. It is only used for SuperSpeed.

bitfield.description: USB Receive Packet Count: Number of packets that must be available in the RX FIFO before the core can start the corresponding USB RX transaction (burst). Don't care if USBRXPKTCNTSEL=0.

bitenum.description: Use when and only when disabled (USBRXPKTCNTSEL=0)

bitfield.description: USB Maximum Receive Burst Size. Maxi IN burst size, when USBRXPKTCNTSEL = 1. When the system bus is slower than the USB, RX FIFO can overrun during a long burst. User can program a smaller value to this field to limit the RX burst size that the core can do. Only applies to SS Bulk / Iso / Int IN endpoints in host mode. Don't care if USBRXPKTCNTSEL=0.

bitenum.description: Use when and only when disabled (USBRXPKTCNTSEL=0)
Burst of up to 1 (minimum value when enabled)

bitfield.description: Always write 0, result of writing of a non-zero value is undetermined.
Always write 0, result of writing of a non-zero value is undetermined.

register.description: Global control register

bitfield.description: Power Down Scale: In P3 state, pipe clock stops and is replaced internally by the suspend clock to create a 16kHz reference. Set field to Fs/16k, rounded up, with Fp suspend clock frequency. Required accuracy is 0-50%
Master Filter Bypass. Bypasses the double-synchronizers and the 5 ms debounce filters on UTMI+ inputs (the latter are not implemented).
Override of the device address, bypassing the SET ADDRESS control transfer. For simulation only.

bitenum.description: Device's address set directly to[9:3] DEVADDR

bitfield.description: If the super speed connection fails during POLL or LMP exchange, the device connects at non-SS mode. If this bit is set, then device attempts three more times to connect at SS, even if it previously failed to operate in SS mode.
Frame scale-down This field scales down device view of a SOF (FS/LS) / uSOF (HS) / ITP (SS) duration.
Port Capability Direction

bitenum.description: Core acts as DRD in host mode
Core acts as OTG DRD, with the mode set by the ID
Core acts as DRD in device mode

bitfield.description: Core Soft Reset. When you reset PHYs (using USBOTGSS_GUSB2PHYCFG or USBOTGSS_GUSB3PIPECTL registers), you must keep the core in reset state until PHY clocks are stable.

Debug Attach. When this bit is set: a) SS Link proceeds directly to the Polling link state (after RUN/STOP in the USBOTGSS_DCTL register is asserted) without checking remote termination. b) Link LFPS polling timeout is infinite c) Polling timeout during TS1 is infinite (in case link is waiting for TXEQ to finish).
RAM Clock Select. No action, hardware always uses bus clock (config 2'b00)
Scale-Down Mode Enable Switches to shorter, non-standard protocol time intervals to speed up simulation. DO NOT MODIFY ON ACTUAL HARDWARE.

bitenum.description: Disable scale-downs. Legal USB timing values are used. Always use on actual hardware.

Enables scaled down values of : - HS/FS/LS: all except Device-mode suspend and resume. - SS: Number of TxEq training sequences reduce to 8 - SS: LFPS polling burst time reduce to 100 ns - SS: LFPS warm reset receive reduce to 30 us - SS: more ...
SS/HS/FS/LS: scale down all the above
HS/FS/LS: scale-down of Device-mode suspend and resume. SS: No TxEq training sequences are sent.

bitfield.description: Disable Scrambling. Transmit request to Link Partner on next transition to Recovery or Polling.
Disable Clock Gating. When this bit is set to 1 and the core is in Low Power mode, internal clock gating is disabled.

register.description: Global status register

bitfield.description: Current BELT Value In Host mode, this field indicates the minimum value of all received device BELT values and the BELT value that is set by the Set Latency Tolerance Value command.
OTG interrupt status
Battery Charger interrupt status: NOT IMPLEMENTED
ADP interrupt status: NOT IMPLEMENTED
Host interrupt status
Device interrupt status
Control/Status Register access Timeout status flag.

bitenum.description: CSR access timed out after 65,535 clock cycles

bitfield.description: Bus Error Address Valid status flag. Also flagged onUSBOTGSS_USBSTS[2] HSE field (host mode) and DEPEVT[12] on XferComplete/XferInProgress event (device mode).

bitenum.description: At least one bus error took place, the first one near address GBUSERRADDR.
No bus error since last clear; GBUSERRADDR is not valid

bitfield.description: Current Mode of Operation.

register.description: Synopsys ID: Core identification and release number. Software uses this register to configure release-specific features in the driver.

bitfield.description: SYNOPSYSID MSBytes: core identifier
SYNOPSYSID LSBytes: version number For instance, version 1.00a =&gt; 0x100A

register.description: Global general-purpose input/output register

bitfield.description: General-purpose output. DO NOT USE: NOT CONNECTED.
General-purpose inputs. TIED LOW.

register.description: Global user ID register

bitfield.description: Application-programmable ID field

register.description: Global user control register

bitfield.description: No Extra Delay between SOF and the 1st packet (when host)

bitenum.description: 2 us delay between SOF and first packet. Some bandwith is lost.
No extra delay. May cause some devices to misbehave.

bitfield.description: Protocol Status Queue Extra Reserved Space (Debug only). Additional space in the PSQ reserved before the USB3 protocl transaction layer (U3PTL) initiates a new USB transaction and burst beats.
Sparse Control Transaction Enable. Valid in host mode only (any speed).

bitenum.description: Feature disabled, no limitation on control transactions
Host controller schedules transactions for Control transfer in different [micro]frames to prevent incorrect behaviour from device.

bitfield.description: Reserving (more) Bandwidth for HS Periodic EPs. Valid in host mode only.

bitenum.description: HC reserves 80% of the bandwidth for periodic EPs
HC reserves 85% of the bandwidth for periodic EPs, which allows 2 high speed, high bandwidth ISOC EPs.

bitfield.description: Compliance Mode for Device Address. Valid in host mode only.

bitenum.description: Device Address is equal to Slot ID.
Increment Device Address on each Address Device command. Slot ID may have different value than Device Address if max_slot_enabled < 128.

bitfield.description: Host IN Auto Retry Enable: host core behaviour upon data packet CRC errors or internal overrun scenarios in non-isochronous IN transfers.

bitenum.description: Auto Retry Disabled: Host core to reply with a terminating retry ACK (Retry=1 and NumP=0)
Auto Retry Enabled: Host core to reply with a non-terminating retry ACK (Retry=1 and NumP!=0)

bitfield.description: Device Timeout Coarse Tuning: time the host waits for a response from device before timeout. Coarse setting.

Device Timeout Fine Tuning: time the host waits for a response from device before timeout. Fine setting. Timer runs on the 125 MHz clock (8 ns period), timeout is DTFT × 256 × 8 ns ~= DTFT × 2 us Don't care unless DTCT=0

register.description: Global Bus Error (non-precise) Address, LSbits: Base address of the first system bus DMA transfer that got a bus error. bitenum.description: 16-bit UTMI @30 MHz, not supported / DDR (8-pin) ULPI, not supported

bitfield.description: HS/FS Timeout Calibration. The number of PHY clocks, as indicated by the application in this field, is multiplied by a bit-time factor; this factor is added to the high-speed/full-speed interpacket timeout duration in the core to account for additional delays introduced by the PHY. This may be required, since the delay introduced by the PHY in generating the linestate condition may vary among PHYs. The USB standard timeout value for high-speed operation is 736 to 816 (inclusive) bit times. The USB standard timeout value for full-speed operation is 16 to 18 (inclusive) bit times. The application must program this field based on the speed of connection. The number of bit times added per PHY clock are: High-speed operation: 8 bit times per 60-MHz PHY clock cycle Full-speed operation: (depending on clock speed) 0.2 bit times per 60-MHz PHY clock cycle 0.25 bit times per 48-MHz PHY clock cycle

Otherwise, LFPS transmission is asserted one clock earlier. - The core requests symbol transmission two pipe_rx_pclks periods after the PHY asserts PhyStatus as a result of the PHY switching from P1 or P2 state to P0 state.

register.description: Device configuration: Configures the core in device mode after power-on or after certain control commands or enumeration. Does not change after initial programming.

bitfield.description: Ignore Packet-Pending for Stream management. From stream-capable bulk endpoints only.

bitenum.description: When Data Packet is received with PP=0 (OUT EP) or ACK is received with NumP=0 and PP=0 (IN EP), search another stream (CStream) to initiate to the host. This is non-optimal a) When host sets PP=0 even though it has not finished with the stream, and b) if the EP is configured with one transfer resource i.e. can't initiate another stream.

PP is ignored for stream selection, no another stream is searched when DP is received with (PP=0) or ACK with (NumP=0, PP=0), to enhance performance if system bus bandwidth is low or host responds to ERDY quickly.

bitfield.description: Link Power Management (LPM) Capability.

bitenum.description: not LPM capable: device cannot respond to LPM transactions.
LPM capable: device shall respond to LPM transactions.

bitfield.description: Number of Receive Buffers. Indicates number of receive buffers to be reported in ACK TP. Value based on RxFIFO size, buffer sizes programmed in descriptors, and system latency.
Interrupt Number. Interrupt/EventQ number on which non-endpoint-specific device related interrupts (see DEVT) are generated.

Periodic Frame Interrupt. Time within a (micro)frame when the application must be notified using the End Of Periodic Frame Interrupt, which can be used to determine if all the periodic (isochronous, interrupt) traffic for that (micro)frame is complete.
Device Address. Configure upon set-address USB command, clear to 0 upon USB reset.
Device Speed: USB speed at which the core should connect. Actual bus speed is determined only after chirp completion, based on the speed of the attached USB host.

bitenum.description: Full Speed (FS): 12 Mbit/s on serial PHY: NOT SUPPORTED
Low Speed (LS): 1.5 Mbit/s on serial PHY: NOT SUPPORTED

register.description: Device control

bitenum.description: Stop USB device controller operation and signal disconnect to attached host. Clear only after all active transfers have been removed. For USB 3.0 disconnection, proceed by changing the target state to RX_DET. [22] DEVCTRLHLT is set once disconect is complete and core is idle.
Start USB device controller operation, after programming the device CSR. Controller will not signal connect to the attached host until the bit is set.

bitfield.description: Core Soft Reset. Auto-cleared. The reset has the following effect: - Interrupts are cleared. - Registers are cleared except: USBOTGSS_GSTS, USBOTGSS_GSNPSID, USBOTGSS_GGPIO, USBOTGSS_GUID, USBOTGSS_GUSB2PHYCFG, USBOTGSS_GUSB3PIPECTL, USBOTGSS_DCFG, USBOTGSS_DCTL, USBOTGSS_DEVTEN, USBOTGSS_DSTS. TxFIFOs and RxFIFO are flushed. - State machines are reset to the idle state, except the device slave. - Transactions on the device bus Master are terminated after completion. - Transactions on the USB are terminated immediately.
Host Initiated Resume Duration (HIRD) Threshold, MSbit: See HIRDTHRES_TIME

Host Initiated Resume Duration (HIRD) Threshold, LSBits = timeout value. utmi_l1_suspend_n is asserted in L1 when : (HIRD value &gt;= HIRDTHRES_TIME) and (HIRDTHRES_4=1) utmi_sleep_n is asserted in L1 when : (HIRD value &lt; HIRDTHRES_TIME) or (HIRDTHRES_4=0)
LPM Response Programmed by Application: Handshake response made to LPM token. Note that if USBOTGSS_DCFG[22] LPMCAP = 0, the response is always timeout (no response).

bitenum.description: NYET handshake to correct LPM transaction if data is pending in Tx FIFO or if OUT (Rx) endpoints are in flow controlled state.
Core shall ACK correct LPM transaction regardless of Tx FIFO status and OUT (Rx) endpoint flow control.

bitfield.description: Used for Save-and-Restore operation. DO NOT USE, SAR NOT IMPLEMENTED

bitenum.description: Prevents device disconnection when RUNSTOP is cleared to 0. Enables the 'Hibernation Request Event' when the link goes to U3/L2. Prevents LTSSM from automatically going to U0/L0 when host requests resume from U3/L2.

bitfield.description: Device Controller Not Ready

bitenum.description: Core is completing the state transitions after hibernation exit. Wait before processing USBLNKST

bitfield.description: Save/Restore Error. NOT SUPPORTED.
Restore State Status, triggered by writing 1 to RSS
Save State Status, triggered by writing 1 to CSS

Core Idle status. asserted when all RxFIFO data transferred to system memory, all completed descriptors are written, and all Event Counts are zero. Changes after reset, so that reset value may not match first readout.

Device Controller Halted. Cleared (0) when theUSBOTGSS_DCTL[31] RUNSTOP is written to 1. Set (1) after USBOTGSS_DCTL[31] RUNSTOP has been written to 0, core is idle and disconnect process is complete. When DEVCTRLHLT =1, no Device events are generated.
USB/Link State. Encoding depends on the connection speed (SS or HS/FS/LS)

bitenum.description: SS: LTSSM = U3 HS/FS/LS: Suspend state
SS: LTSSM = SS_DIS HS/FS/LS: Disconnected state (default)
SS: LTSSM = Reset/Resume. USB resume or reset received from the host while in suspend. Write RECOV=8 to[8:5] ULSTCHNGREQ field to acknowledge it. HS/FS/LS: Resume
SS: LTSSM = U2 HS/FS/LS: Sleep state
SS: LTSSM = U0 HS/FS/LS: On state
SS: LTSSM = RX_DET HS/FS/LS: Early Suspend state

bitfield.description: Rx FIFO Empty
received Start Of Frame's Frame Number
Connection Speed. USB speed at which the device has come up after speed detection through a chirp sequence.

bitenum.description: Full Speed (FS): 12 Mbit/s on serial PHY: NOT SUPPORTED
Low Speed (LS): 1.5 Mbit/s on serial PHY: NOT SUPPORTED

register.description: Device generic command parameter: To be programmed before or along with the device command itself.

bitfield.description: Parameter of the command; command-dependent.

register.description: Device generic command: Generic command interface to send link management packets and notifications.

bitfield.description: Command Status.

bitenum.description: CmdErr: Error while processing the command.

bitfield.description: Command active. Auto-cleared.
Command Interrupt On Complete. Event mapped to interrupt numberUSBOTGSS_DCFG[16:12] INTNUM. Reads return 0.

bitenum.description: Generic Command Completion event to be issued after executing the command.

bitfield.description: Command Type. Reads return 0.

bitenum.description: Set Endpoint NRDY: Makes the core think that the given endpoint is in an NRDY state. If buffers are available in that endpoint, an ERDY is immediately transmitted. Parameter[4:0] = Physical Endpoint Number
Transmit Function Wake Device Notification (Notification-only in SuperSpeed) Parameter[7:0] - Interface Number (IntfNum) that caused remote wakeup
Transmit Function Host Role Request Device Notification (Notification-only in SuperSpeed) Parameter[1:0] = RSP Phase (Notification Type Specific) is INITIATE (2'b01) or CONFIRM (2'b10).

Set Periodic Parameters Parameter[9:0] (SystemExitLatency): Set value programmed by the host through the Set SEL device request, in microseconds. The Set SEL control transfer has 6 bytes of data and contains 4 values; Refer to the USB 3.0 spec, Section 9.4.12. Offset / Name / Meaning: 0 U1SEL Time in us for U1 System Exit Latency 1 U1PEL Time in us for U1 Device to Host Exit Latency 2 U2SEL Time in us for U2 System Exit Latency 4 U2PEL Time in us for U2 Device to Host Exit Latency If the device is enabled for U1 and U2, then the U2PEL should be programmed. If the device is enabled only for U1, then U1PEL should be programmed into this parameter. If the value is greater than 125 us, then the software must program a value of zero into this register.
Transmit Set Link Function LPM. (Reserved in non-SuperSpeed operations) Parameter[0] = [Force_LinkPM_Accept] (0: De-assert 1: Assert)
Selected FIFO Flush Parameter[4:0] = FIFO Number Paramer[5] = TX FIFO (1) or RX FIFO (0)

Run device Bus LoopBack Test: Issue this command first, then the Start Transfer command to EP 0 and 1. Configure EP0 as OUT and EP1 as IN. The core reads data from the IN buffers and writes it back to OUT buffers. The IN and OUT must have an equal amount of data buffer. The endpoint 1 Tx-FIFO default value of (512/8)+2 = 66 should be changed to (1024/8)+2 = 130 for loopback mode. Parameter[0] = enable (1) and disable (0) Loopback mode.

register.description: Device active USB endpoint enable. Set each bit (1) to enable the corresponding endpoint. Bits 0 and 1 are set after USB reset as they enable the control endpoint. All other bits are set according to enumeration, and cleared on a USB reset.

bitfield.description: Read: Event parameters (see, ). Command Completion Status. Additional information about the command completion. Same format as bits 15:12 of the Endpoint Command Complete event.
HighPriority/ForceRM. Write-only field, reads return 0. Start Transfer command: HighPriority value End Transfer command: ForceRM value
Command Active. Auto-cleared.

Write: Command parameters (see , ) command-dependent: DEPSTRTXFER on isoc EP: [31:16] microframe number for the first TRB (StartMicroFramNum) DEPSTRTXFER on stream-capable EP: [31:16] USB stream ID for the transfer (StreamID) DEPUPDXFER/DEPENDXFER: [22:16] Transfer resource index returned by HW upon transfer start (XferRscIdx) DEPSTARTCFG: [22:16] Transfer resource index assigned by software upon new configuration start (XferRscIdx)
Command Completion Status. Additional information about the command completion. Same format as bits 15:12 of the Endpoint Command Complete event.
HighPriority/ForceRM. Write-only field, reads return 0. Start Transfer command: HighPriority value End Transfer command: ForceRM value
Command Active. Auto-cleared.

bitenum.description: Endpoint is ready to accept another command, CmdStatus field is valid. The effects of the previously-issued command may not all have taken place yet.

bitfield.description: Register is stored in RAM, so that the field is actually writable (value is still don't care).
Command Interrupt On Complete. Event mapped to interrupt number DEPCFG.IntNum (the command). Reads return 0.

bitenum.description: generic Endpoint Command Complete event issued after executing the command.

bitfield.description: Register is stored in RAM, so that the field is actually writable (value is still don't care).
Command Type.

bitenum.description: DEPGETDSEQ: Get Data Sequence Number (No Parameter)
DEPXFERCFG: Set Endpoint Transfer Resource Configuration (32-bit parameter)

register.description: OTG configuration

bitfield.description: Protects OTG, PHY and VBUS filters from the following software resets: xHCIUSBOTGSS_USBCMD[1] HCRST (host), USBOTGSS_DCTL[30] CSFTRST (device). Note: In OTG2 applications, it is not recommended to program USBOTGSS_USBCMD[1] HCRST during role switch.

bitenum.description: OTG logic reset by software resets
OTG logic not affected by software resets. Use only with[13:12] PRTCAPDIR = 0x3

bitfield.description: Debug, always write 0.
HNP Capabilty Enable.
SRP Capability enable. For A-device, SRP detection. For B-device, SRP generation.

register.description: OTG control IMPORTANT NOTE: Register is reinitialized on ID change, but is not affected by a software reset.

bitfield.description: To be set upon TRSP_ACK_ERR, TRSP_CNF_ERR, or TRSP_WRST_ERR timeout. Auto-cleared. OTG3: NOT IMPLEMENTED, DO NOT SET.

bitenum.description: LTSSM transition to error state is pending
Sends LTSSM to error state during OTG 3.0 RSP

bitfield.description: Peripheral Mode. Program the core to work as a peripheral or as a host.

bitenum.description: OTG device acts as a peripheral
OTG device acts as a host

bitfield.description: Port Power Control. Set or cleared by software. Self-cleared in any of the following conditions: 1) transition to a_idle OTG state 2) aidl_bdis_tout event when in a_suspend OTG state 3) a_wait_bcon_tout event when in a_wait_bcon OTG state 4) transition to any b_* OTG state

bitenum.description: Initiate the VBUS drive on the USB, when A-device.

bitfield.description: HNP Request. Set (1) by software to initiate HNP request to the connected USB host. Clear (0) by software upon eitherUSBOTGSS_OEVT[11] OTGBDEVHOSTENDEVNT or USBOTGSS_OEVT[8] OTGBDEVVBUSCHNGEVNT.
Session Request. In the absence ofUSBOTGSS_OEVT[9] OTGBDEVSESSVLDDETEVNT after a request, the application must wait for at least TB_SRP_FAIL (6 secs) before another request.

bitenum.description: Initiate the SRP (data line pulsing) on the USB.

bitfield.description: TermSelect Data Line Pulse. Alternate SRP data line pulsing method on UTMI interface.
Device Set HNP Enable. To be set when HNP has been successfully enabled by the connected host, using the SetFeature.SetHNPEnable command.
Host Set HNP Enable. To be set when HNP has been successfully enabled on the connected device, using the SetFeature.SetHNPEnable command.

register.description: OTG event: OTG interrupt status. All writable bits are cleared by writing a 1.

bitfield.description: Dual-role device's mode, based on iddig input.
Connector ID status change event. Set in both A-device and B-device mode.
Host Role Request Confirm Notifier Event. Set upon reception of HRR Device Notification TP with Confirm field set. Set in OTG3, SS, A-host or B-host mode only. OTG3: NOT IMPLEMENTED
Host Role Request Initiate Notifier Event. Set upon reception of HRR Device Notification TP with Initiate field set. Set in OTG3, SS, A-host or B-host mode only. OTG3: NOT IMPLEMENTED
A-device A-IDLE Event. Set when OTG FSM enters A-IDLE state from any other state. Set in A-device mode only. OTG3: NOT IMPLEMENTED
A-device B-host End Event. Set when connected B-device has completed its B-host role and returns to B-peripheral. Set in A-device mode only.
A-device Host Event. Set when device enters host role, upon initial connect to B-device as well as upon HNP from A-peripheral to A-host. Set in A-device mode only.
A-device HNP change Detected Event. Set when there is an HNP event. Set in A-device mode only.
A-device SRP Detected Event. Set when SRP request from B-device is detected. Set in A-device mode only.
A-device Session End Detected Event. Set when UTMI input 'a-vbus-valid' is deasserted (0). Set in A-device mode only.
B-device Host End Event. Set completing B-host role and returning to default B-peripheral role. Set in B-device mode only.
B-device HNP Change Event. Set upon (success of failure of an) HNP attempt. Set in B-device mode only.
B-device Session Valid Detected Event. Set when B-device succeeds in starting a session. Set in B-device mode only.
B-device VBUS Change Event. Set when UTMI input 'b-session-valid' transitions (to 0 or 1). Set in B-device mode only.
B-Session Valid. Updated when OTGBDevVBUSChngEvnt is set.

bitenum.description: B-session is not valid on VBUS

bitfield.description: Host Negociation Status. Updated when OTGADevHNPChngEvnt or OTGBDevHNPChngEvnt is set.

bitenum.description: Host negotiation failure. In A-device, indicates imminent end of session indication from core. In B-device, it indicates that the timer used to wait for an A-device to signal a connection (b_ase0_brst_tmout) timed out resulting in B-device staying as B-peripheral.

bitfield.description: Session Request Status. Updated when OTGBDevSessVldDetEvnt is set.

bitenum.description: Session started as a result of successful SRP.
Session not started as a result of SRP.

bitfield.description: No errors currently defined.

register.description: OTG event enable: OTG interrupt event enable.

bitfield.description: Connector ID Status Change Event Enable.
Host Role Request Confirm Notifier Event Enable. OTG3: NOT IMPLEMENTED
Host Role Request Initiate Notifier Event Enable. OTG3: NOT IMPLEMENTED
A-device A-IDLE Event Enable.
A-device B-host End Event Enable.
A-device Host Event Enable.
A-device HNP change Detected Event Enable.
A-device SRP Detected Event Enable.
A-device Session End Detected Event Enable.
B-device Host End Event Enable.
B-device HNP Change Event Enable.
B-device Session Valid Detected Event Enable.
B-device VBUS Change Event Enable.

register.description: OTG status

bitfield.description: [A-device and B-device] OTG state machine state, for debug. Default value can vary depending on integration.
[A-device and B-device] Current role of the controller
[A-device] xHCI host port power. Reflects host bit fieldUSBOTGSS_PORTSC1/2[9] PP.
[B-device] VBUS B-session valid status
[A-device] VBUS valid status
[A-device and B-device] Connector ID status. Default value can vary depending on integration.
